metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46705 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A spoofing issue existed in the handling of URLs. This issue was addressedwith improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, Safari 16.2. Visiting a malicious website maylead to address bar spoofing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
